>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Post the genders of yourself and the people involved if your query when asking for a reading
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

>Who is the Nobody?
The Nobody is a figure alive today who has extraordinary spiritual powers, including the ability to influence reality with his conscious and unconscious mind, and intuitively receive guidance from the forces of Heaven.

He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. Everyone's truest desires are mutual. The only motive is love.

>Does a god beg other beings for help?
Yeah?
"Beg" is a poor word choice, but there's tons of myths in just about every polytheistic belief system where a god goes to another god for help. Hell, sometimes they just go to spirits that aren't gods!
These things are typically reciprocal: god X helps god Y with something that is more within the sphere of influence of X, and in exchange god Y does something that's more in the realm of Y. Likewise, most LHP rituals which invoke entities involve offering them something in return (if you don't give them something explicitly, that probably means they're taking something and you just don't know about it).

I lie down on my back , I put white noise on my earphones and put a scarf on my eyes to block any light, and I decided to move as little as possible without it being uncomfortable, for example I can scratch an itch and swallow and basically move just how I want if necessary, I just didn't turn around and stayed on my back, every few minutes I did that sleeping technique where you tense your entire body subsequently and then relax, one important thing I did was actively having a monologue about things that happened in the day, about random stuff I could speak about to myself, and nothing too exciting like philosophical questions or subjects that get me angry.
I was also breathing through my nose slowly to simulate sleep breathing.

For 30 mins, nothing interesting happened, I had some random semi-vivid images in my head that sometimes were moving like a video, and then few minutes later , I felt like I wasn't breathing well enough through so I wanted to open my mouth, and this is where it began

2) the experience:
My entire body was paralyzed, which is nothing new to me, but this time, I wasn't bombarded by loud explosions and strong sensations, instead the white noise on my earphones morphed into familiar voices and sounds of children laughing and playing around, I knew very well that I was hallucinating sounds, in fact, I've never been this conscious in hypnogogia before, I knew very well what was happening to me, I knew how much time had passed, what I did in the day, what I was thinking about just a few minutes when I was awake, but one thing I forgot which is that my vision was blocked by that scarf, so I believed that I was actually seeing my window.....

The last thing I'll say regarding all of this, is that if you have good psychedelics, you don't need weed. There's the common belief that cannabis enhances psychedelics, but I really don't think this is true anymore. It just clouds the experience. Taking acid or mushrooms almost allows you to be more clear-headed than you normally are when you're sober. That's why people call them mind expanding. Cannabis counteracts this but still infuses you with extra energy which can make things go awry. After I had my bad trip and subsequent psychotic break, I made sure to take acid again a year later, and since that bad trip I've probably tripped 5-7 times. The one thing I have noticed upon reflecting back on these trips, as well as uncomfortable or weird trips (but not horrendously bad) before my really bad trip, was that things always started going wrong AFTER I smoked a lot of weed on the trip. I found that if I tripped and didn't smoke weed, I usually wouldn't descend into that paranoid state. You don't always need more drugs

threads.com:
This thread was requested by AstralProjectionAnon who is found in the Astral Projection OOBE generals. Let me take this time to first let you know I AM NOT AN EXPERT. There are many things I cannot do at all or consistently. But hopefully you can find some information that helps you.

I'll start with the concept of shutting yourself up to experience travel. Everyone does this although they may not realize it. Being able to do so completely and for a long duration of time will equate to more things you can do. What's most important is learning how to recognize Silence.

How do you know when you are Silent? Truthfully it's difficult and particular to you. I can only do so partially for a while without help. (We can talk about help, but I will say only ask if you can at least go partially Silent by yourself.) You know that voice in your head reminding you of dishes, laundry, that essay due in a week? That's part of it. That earworm song you just can't get out of your head? Also part of it. Scenes replaying in your head is also part of it. However this is hardly a complete list, and it may be different for you. I have two layers: the verbal (and learned) mind chatter and the symbolic (my innate) mind chatter. There are techniques that help get rid of these things, but it will take time and practice none the less.

Once you start actually shutting yourself up, you will notice weird colors around. They may swirl or billow -some sort of movement- and they may be dull or bright. If you see it at all, you are at least a little successful. Using glownigger speak, this is entering hypnogogia. This is always step one. From there, I just did and observed to get where I am.

Now some questions for you, Apanon:
1. How long ago have you noticed the caves?
2. How much after did you notice the tunnels?
